brief_title: CD4 T cell response to pH1N1 vaccination
condition_studied: CD4 T cell and neutralizing antibody responses
description: Healthy adult human subjects were given monovalent inactivated pH1N1 vaccine and antibody responses were assessed using HAI and MN assays.  CD4 T cell reactivity was examined using IFNg Elispot assays to look at reactivity to unique and conserved peptide pools.
endpoints: HAI assay and microneutralization assay to determine antibody titers, cytokine Elispot assay to quantify CD4 T cell response
hypothesis: pH1N1 vaccination increases CD4 T cell reactivity to conserved CD4 T cell epitopes and this increase in CD4 T cell reactivity correlates with the development of neutralizing antibody responses.
objectives: Determine CD4 T cell reactivity to unique HA and NA, conserved HA, and conserved NP/M1 peptide pools and correlate baseline numbers and boosting of CD4 T cell responses with neutralizing antibody titers.
official_title: CD4 T-cell expansion predicts neutralizing antibody responses to monovalent inactivated pandemic H1N1 influenza vaccine

arm.name: Age 18-32

pubmed.title: CD4+ T-cell expansion predicts neutralizing antibody responses to monovalent, inactivated 2009 pandemic influenza A(H1N1) virus subtype H1N1 vaccine.
